meanings.definition: In a way that is difficult or impossible to control or handle.
meanings.sent1: The puppy ran unmanageably around the house, knocking over everything in its path.
meanings.sent2: She laughed unmanageably at the silly joke her friend told.
meanings.sent3: The toddler danced unmanageably to the music, tripping over their own feet.
meanings.sent4: The wind blew unmanageably, scattering leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The car skidded unmanageably on the icy road, unable to stop in time.

meanings.definition: To an extent that is beyond the ability to be managed or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The workload piled up unmanageably, causing stress for the employees.
meanings.sent2: The weeds in the garden grew unmanageably tall, blocking the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The party invitations spread unmanageably, reaching people from different countries.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions overflowed unmanageably, leading to an outburst of tears.
meanings.sent5: The river flooded unmanageably, submerging the nearby fields.
